Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, fabric is black in section, interior covered with a dark-brown resinous substance, with remains of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink on the exterior, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36388) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36388)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 245 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
